clusters.title: Attempted coup in Benin has been ‘foiled,’ country’s interior minister says
clusters.neutral_headline: Benin coup attempt foiled by loyalist troops, interior minister says

items.title: Attempted coup in Benin has been ‘foiled,’ country’s interior minister says
items.standfirst: A coup that was announced in Benin has been “foiled,” the interior minister said Sunday in a video on Facebook, but there was no word from the president and sporadic gunshots were heard in parts of the administrative capital, Cotonou.
items.content: A coup that was announced in Benin has been “foiled,” the interior minister said Sunday in a video on Facebook, but there was no word from the president and sporadic gunshots were heard in parts of the administrative capital, Cotonou.

items.title: Apparent coup attempt in Benin thwarted, interior minister says
items.standfirst: Earlier Sunday, a group of soldiers appeared on Benin's state TV to announce the dissolution of the government in an apparent coup, the latest of many in West Africa.
items.content: Earlier Sunday, a group of soldiers appeared on Benin's state TV to announce the dissolution of the government in an apparent coup, the latest of many in West Africa.

items.title: Benin coup attempt foiled by loyalist troops, interior minister says
items.standfirst: A presidential adviser tells the BBC that President Patrice Talon is in a safe location.
items.content: A presidential adviser tells the BBC that President Patrice Talon is in a safe location.

items.title: Benin: the government declares coup attempt has been 'foiled'
items.standfirst: A coup that was announced in Benin on Sunday has been "foiled", the interior minister said in a video on Facebook. Earlier, a group of soldiers had appeared on Benin ’s state TV to announce the dissolution of the government in an apparent coup, the latest of many in West Africa. Details and analysis by FRANCE 24 international affairs editor, Kethevane Gorjestani.
items.content: A coup that was announced in Benin on Sunday has been "foiled", the interior minister said in a video on Facebook. Earlier, a group of soldiers had appeared on Benin ’s state TV to announce the dissolution of the government in an apparent coup, the latest of many in West Africa. Details and analysis by FRANCE 24 international affairs editor, Kethevane Gorjestani.

items.title: Benin: Government says fourteen people arrested over coup attempt
items.standfirst: Fourteen people have been arrested in connection with an attempted coup in Benin, a government spokesperson told Reuters on Sunday. Earlier in the day, a group of soldiers in the West African nation claimed on national television that they had seized power. Analysis by Berverly Ochieng, senior analyst at Control Risk's Global Risk Analysis in Dakar, Senegal.
items.content: Fourteen people have been arrested in connection with an attempted coup in Benin, a government spokesperson told Reuters on Sunday. Earlier in the day, a group of soldiers in the West African nation claimed on national television that they had seized power. Analysis by Berverly Ochieng, senior analyst at Control Risk's Global Risk Analysis in Dakar, Senegal.

items.title: Benin’s gov’t says it thwarted coup attempt after troops declared takeover
items.standfirst: Soldiers in Benin appeared on state television to say they had toppled President Patrice Talon and taken power.
items.content: Soldiers in Benin appeared on state television to say they had toppled President Patrice Talon and taken power.

items.title: Attempted coup d'état in Benin: Foreign minister says situation under control
items.standfirst: Benin's government said on Sunday its armed forces had foiled a coup attempt after a group of soldiers in the West African nation claimed on national television to have seized power. Details by FRANCE 24 international affairs editor, Shirli Sitbon.
items.content: Benin's government said on Sunday its armed forces had foiled a coup attempt after a group of soldiers in the West African nation claimed on national television to have seized power. Details by FRANCE 24 international affairs editor, Shirli Sitbon.

items.title: Benin attempted coup 'foiled' after soldiers claimed to have seized power
items.standfirst: Benin's government says its armed forces have "foiled" an attempted coup after soldiers claimed on national television they had seized power.
items.content: Benin's government says its armed forces have "foiled" an attempted coup after soldiers claimed on national television they had seized power.

items.title: Benin's interior minister says a coup announced earlier has been foiled
items.standfirst: Earlier, a group of soldiers had appeared on Benin 's state TV Sunday to announce the dissolution of the government in an apparent coup, the latest of many in West Africa.
items.content: Earlier, a group of soldiers had appeared on Benin 's state TV Sunday to announce the dissolution of the government in an apparent coup, the latest of many in West Africa.(Image credit: Eraldo Peres)

clusters.title: Briton Lando Norris wins his first F1 title in Abu Dhabi
clusters.neutral_headline: Lando Norris wins maiden F1 world championship title at Abu Dhabi GP

items.title: Briton Lando Norris wins his first F1 title in Abu Dhabi
items.standfirst: The tearful 26-year-old thanks his family after he seals the championship by finishing third in the season-ending grand prix.
items.content: The tearful 26-year-old thanks his family after he seals the championship by finishing third in the season-ending grand prix.

items.title: McLaren's Lando Norris wins first F1 title at season-ending Abu Dhabi Grand Prix
items.standfirst: Red Bull driver and defending champion Max Verstappen won the race with Norris placing third, which allowed Norris to finish two points ahead of Verstappen in the season-long standings.
items.content: Red Bull driver and defending champion Max Verstappen won the race with Norris placing third, which allowed Norris to finish two points ahead of Verstappen in the season-long standings.(Image credit: Darko Bandic)

items.title: Lando Norris wins maiden F1 world championship title at Abu Dhabi GP
items.standfirst: Norris finished third behind Max Verstappen in final race to deliver McLaren its first world drivers' crown since 2008.
items.content: Norris finished third behind Max Verstappen in final race to deliver McLaren its first world drivers' crown since 2008.

items.title: McLaren's Lando Norris wins his first Formula 1 world championship
items.standfirst: McLaren driver Lando Norris secured his first Formula 1 championship at the season-ending Abu Dhabi Grand Prix on Sunday. Although Red Bull’s defending champion Max Verstappen won the race, Norris finished third, just behind his McLaren teammate Oscar Piastri, who came in second. This result put Norris two points ahead of Verstappen in the final season standings, clinching the title.
items.content: McLaren driver Lando Norris secured his first Formula 1 championship at the season-ending Abu Dhabi Grand Prix on Sunday. Although Red Bull’s defending champion Max Verstappen won the race, Norris finished third, just behind his McLaren teammate Oscar Piastri, who came in second. This result put Norris two points ahead of Verstappen in the final season standings, clinching the title.

items.title: Lando Norris wins first F1 World Championship
items.standfirst: Lando Norris won his maiden Formula 1 World Drivers' Championship on Sunday after coming third in the deciding showdown in Abu Dhabi.
items.content: Lando Norris won his maiden Formula 1 World Drivers' Championship on Sunday after coming third in the deciding showdown in Abu Dhabi.

items.standfirst: At least 25 people, including tourists, were killed in a fire at a popular nightclub in India's Goa state, the state's chief minister said Sunday.
items.content: At least 25 people, including tourists, were killed in a fire at a popular nightclub in India's Goa state, the state's chief minister said Sunday.(Image credit: AP)

items.title: Tourists among at least 25 killed in Goa nightclub fire
items.standfirst: Fire broke out at midnight in Arpora with victims mostly kitchen workers, according to state’s chief ministerAt least 25 people have been killed in a fire at a nightclub in Goa, an Indian state popular for its nightlife and tourism.Several tourists were among the 25 dead in the fire, which broke out at about midnight at Birch by Romeo Lane, a popular restaurant, cocktail bar and club in Arpora, a district of north Goa. items.title: National Park Service drops free admission on MLK Day, Juneteenth while adding Trump's birthday
National parks fee-free calendar drops MLK Day, Juneteenth and adds Trump's birthday
items.standfirst: The Trump administration, which has railed against what it describes as "woke" policies, removed MLK Day and Juneteenth from next year's list of fare-exempt days for visitors at dozens of national parks.
items.content: The Trump administration, which has railed against what it describes as "woke" policies, removed MLK Day and Juneteenth from next year's list of fare-exempt days for visitors at dozens of national parks.(Image credit: Brandon Bell)

items.title: Americans to get free entry to parks on Trump's birthday

items.content: At the same time, the Trump administration is withdrawing free entry on Martin Luther King Jr Day and Juneteenth.

items.content: The next phase of the Gaza ceasefire involves an international security force and other measures and has not yet started.

items.title: First phase of Gaza ceasefire plan nearly complete, says Netanyahu
items.standfirst: Israeli PM to discuss next steps with Donald Trump this month but timetable for lasting peace remains unclearBenjamin Netanyahu has said that the first phase of the UN-endorsed Gaza ceasefire plan is close to completion, and that the second phase must involve the disarmament of Hamas.The Israeli prime minister said he would discuss the next steps later this month in Washington with Donald Trump, whose Gaza proposals were codified in a UN security council resolution on 17 November. Continue reading...

items.title: Netanyahu says Israel and Hamas expected to begin Gaza ceasefire's second phase soon
items.standfirst: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Sunday that he expected the second phase of the Gaza ceasefire to begin "very shortly" once Hamas returns the remains of the last hostage whose body was taken by Palestinian militants during the October 7, 2023 attacks.
items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Sunday that he expected the second phase of the Gaza ceasefire to begin "very shortly" once Hamas returns the remains of the last hostage whose body was taken by Palestinian militants during the October 7, 2023 attacks.

items.title: Full transcript of "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," Dec. 7, 2025
items.standfirst: On this "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" broadcast, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and Rep. Ilhan Omar join Margaret Brennan.
items.content: On this "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" broadcast, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and Rep. Ilhan Omar join Margaret Brennan.

items.title: 12/7: Face The Nation
items.standfirst: This week on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," an interview with Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent as more Americans say they're feeling the pain of higher prices this holiday season. Plus, Democratic Rep. Ilhan Omar joins to discuss the Trump administration's immigration crackdown on Somalis in Minneapolis.
items.content: This week on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," an interview with Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent as more Americans say they're feeling the pain of higher prices this holiday season. Plus, Democratic Rep. Ilhan Omar joins to discuss the Trump administration's immigration crackdown on Somalis in Minneapolis.

items.title: Face the Nation: Himes, Gottlieb
items.standfirst: Missed the second half of the show? Rep. Jim Himes and former FDA Commissioner Scott Gottlieb join.
items.content: Missed the second half of the show? Rep. Jim Himes and former FDA Commissioner Scott Gottlieb join.

items.title: Scott Gottlieb says Hepatitis B vaccine birth dose prevents chronic infection
items.standfirst: As the CDC vaccine panel voted last week to stop recommending the birth dose of the Hepatitis B vaccine, former FDA Commissioner Scott Gottlieb, who now serves on the boards of Pfizer and United Healthcare, told "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that the birth dose is " almost 99% effective at preventing that chronic infection."
items.content: As the CDC vaccine panel voted last week to stop recommending the birth dose of the Hepatitis B vaccine, former FDA Commissioner Scott Gottlieb, who now serves on the boards of Pfizer and United Healthcare, told "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that the birth dose is " almost 99% effective at preventing that chronic infection."

items.title: Scott Bessent calls it a "strong holiday season," despite even reports from some toy companies
items.standfirst: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent predicted on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that it will be a "strong holiday season" despite some major toy companies noting higher prices due to tariffs and inflation. "The economy has been better than we thought," Bessent said, adding "we've had the 4- 4% GDP growth in a couple of quarters."
items.content: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent predicted on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that it will be a "strong holiday season" despite some major toy companies noting higher prices due to tariffs and inflation. "The economy has been better than we thought," Bessent said, adding "we've had the 4- 4% GDP growth in a couple of quarters."

items.standfirst: This week on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," an interview with Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent as more Americans say they're feeling the pain of higher prices this holiday season. Plus, Democratic Rep. Ilhan Omar joins to discuss the Trump administration's immigration crackdown on Somalis in Minneapolis.

Plus, Democratic Rep. Ilhan Omar joins to discuss the Trump administration's immigration crackdown on Somalis in Minneapolis.

items.title: 11/2: Face the Nation
items.standfirst: This week on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," as the government shutdown stretches on, Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy, Democratic Sen. Mark Warner and Republican Rep. Dan Crenshaw join to discuss the impacts. Plus, Anthony Salvanto breaks down the latest CBS News poll.
items.content: This week on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," as the government shutdown stretches on, Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy, Democratic Sen. Mark Warner and Republican Rep. Dan Crenshaw join to discuss the impacts. Plus, Anthony Salvanto breaks down the latest CBS News poll.

items.title: Russia unleashes massive drone attack on central Ukraine, as peace talks stall
items.standfirst: Russia unleashed a major missile and drone barrage on Ukraine overnight into Saturday, while Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said he had a “substantive phone call” with American officials engaged in talks with a Ukrainian delegation in Florida, aimed at ending the nearly 4-year war. Story by Liza Kaminov.
items.content: Russia unleashed a major missile and drone barrage on Ukraine overnight into Saturday, while Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said he had a “substantive phone call” with American officials engaged in talks with a Ukrainian delegation in Florida, aimed at ending the nearly 4-year war. Story by Liza Kaminov.

items.title: As Key Talent Abandons Apple, Meet the New Generation of Leaders Taking On the Old Guard
items.standfirst: With “hardware guy” John Ternus as frontrunner for the next CEO, can Apple overtake its ex-employees at OpenAI and Meta?

clusters.title: 210,000 power banks sold on Amazon recalled over fire and burn risks
clusters.neutral_headline: 210,000 power banks sold on Amazon recalled over fire and burn risks

items.title: 210,000 power banks sold on Amazon recalled over fire and burn risks
items.standfirst: The recall involves INIU 100,000mAh portable power banks, model BI-B41that were sold on Amazon between August 2021 and April 2022, the recall notice says.
items.content: The recall involves INIU 100,000mAh portable power banks, model BI-B41that were sold on Amazon between August 2021 and April 2022, the recall notice says.

clusters.title: Gaza mediators Qatar and Egypt call for next steps of the truce
clusters.neutral_headline: Qatar and Egypt urge Israeli withdrawal to secure next step in Gaza peace deal

items.title: Gaza mediators Qatar and Egypt call for next steps of the truce
items.standfirst: Qatar and Egypt, guarantors of the Gaza ceasefire, called on Saturday for the withdrawal of Israeli troops and the deployment of an international stabilisation force as the necessary next steps in fully implementing the fragile agreement. The measures were spelt out in the US- and UN-backed peace plan that has largely halted fighting, though the warring parties have yet to agree on how to move forward from the deal's first phase. Details by FRANCE 24 correspondent in Jerusalem, Noga Tarnopolsky.
items.content: Qatar and Egypt, guarantors of the Gaza ceasefire, called on Saturday for the withdrawal of Israeli troops and the deployment of an international stabilisation force as the necessary next steps in fully implementing the fragile agreement. The measures were spelt out in the US- and UN-backed peace plan that has largely halted fighting, though the warring parties have yet to agree on how to move forward from the deal's first phase. Details by FRANCE 24 correspondent in Jerusalem, Noga Tarnopolsky.

clusters.title: Bethlehem lights up for Christmas for first time since Gaza genocide began
clusters.neutral_headline: Bethlehem lights up for Christmas for first time since Gaza genocide began

items.title: Bethlehem lights up for Christmas for first time since Gaza genocide began
items.standfirst: Bethlehem has lit its Christmas tree for the first time since Israel began its genocide on Palestinians in Gaza.
items.content: Bethlehem has lit its Christmas tree for the first time since Israel began its genocide on Palestinians in Gaza.

items.title: Bethlehem Christmas tree illuminated for first time since Gaza war began
items.standfirst: Hundreds gathered in Manger Square to bask in the festivities that included music, dancing and Santas bearing sweet treats.
items.content: Hundreds gathered in Manger Square to bask in the festivities that included music, dancing and Santas bearing sweet treats.

items.title: Bethlehem Christmas tree lights up for first time since start of Gaza war
items.standfirst: For the past two years all public Christmas celebrations have been cancelled in Bethlehem in the occupied West Bank.
items.content: For the past two years all public Christmas celebrations have been cancelled in Bethlehem in the occupied West Bank.

clusters.title: Waymo will recall software after its self-driving cars passed stopped school buses
clusters.neutral_headline: Waymo Plans Software Recall to Address Bus Incidents

items.title: Waymo will recall software after its self-driving cars passed stopped school buses
items.standfirst: Waymo is issuing a software recall for its self-driving cars after reports the company's autonomous vehicles failed to stop for school buses.
items.content: Waymo is issuing a software recall for its self-driving cars after reports the company's autonomous vehicles failed to stop for school buses.(Image credit: Charly Triballeau)

items.title: Waymo Plans Software Recall to Address Bus Incidents
items.standfirst: Waymo said it will file a voluntary software recall with US federal authorities after its autonomously driven vehicles repeatedly failed to fully slow or stop for school buses.
items.content: Waymo said it will file a voluntary software recall with US federal authorities after its autonomously driven vehicles repeatedly failed to fully slow or stop for school buses.

clusters.title: Deadly attack on kindergarten reported in Sudan
clusters.neutral_headline: Deadly attack on kindergarten reported in Sudan

items.title: Deadly attack on kindergarten reported in Sudan
items.standfirst: Drone strikes on a town in South Kordofan on Thursday are said to have killed at least 50 people.
items.content: Drone strikes on a town in South Kordofan on Thursday are said to have killed at least 50 people.

items.title: At least 33 children killed in paramilitary drone attack on nursery
items.standfirst: At least 50 people, including 33 children, have been killed in southern Sudan after a drone attack by paramilitary forces hit a nursery in South Kordofan state.
items.content: At least 50 people, including 33 children, have been killed in southern Sudan after a drone attack by paramilitary forces hit a nursery in South Kordofan state.
